website_summaries.verdict: This game includes over 6,000 "totem" images you can use to express yourself, your positive perception of others, gratitude toward others, and more. A great team builder.
pros: A positive tool for work settings as well as family and friend gatherings
The goal is for players to feel understood and loved
cons: If you have a very large team or group of co-workers, it may be best to break play down into smaller groups for greatest effectiveness

customer_reviews.title: Good family therapy
customer_reviews.text: My teen daughter is currently in a residential mental health clinic batteling her bipolar depression. She struggles with negative thoughts about herself and most visits we have had are going in circles about her self doubt and insecurities. She is an amazing young woman but her illness won’t let her see that. I bought this in hopes to help shift our conversation during our visit. It was just her, myself and my husband and we played two rounds. It didn’t take long to get the hang of it. I do think it would have been more fun to play with at least 4 people but three worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great small team building game
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a team-building game with a group of adults. We're a small enough team that we can be a little vulnerable together. It's also a good way to offset the every day business environment when so much attention is on fixing problems. For once they got to say good things about one another, and serious think about what strengths everyone brought to the work we do. Very positive, and I don't think they were faking it more than a little. It is scary to be real together, but healthy and far more productive than pretending to be perfect with one another.
customer_reviews.author: Lindley Karstens

customer_reviews.title: The pictures are really lovely- the descriptions easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: I worried this game might be too cheesy, but it's not. The pictures are really lovely- the descriptions easy to understand. I was blown away by the attentiveness of the kids and adults I've played this with. It has enough structure that the game is clear while allowing for a lot of creativity for people to share with one another. And it's not all serious... we've had tons of laughs playing it as people see things in one another we don't see in ourselves- enlightening any humorous! Fun to replay even with the same group. -Signed either a Fair Goat or a Witty HedgeHog :)
customer_reviews.author: Mom Times Three

customer_reviews.title: My friends and I love this game
customer_reviews.text: My friends and I love this game. It generates wonderful opportunities for bonding, understanding each other and ourselves better. Another great thing about this game is that all the players are equally engaged in every turn which makes it really fun. I think I've played about 5 times since getting the game with various people and I've never seen anyone get bored or distracted. People feel loved, appreciated and understood playing this game!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: A nice game to boost self esteem and share your thoughts about loved ones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our family vacation that is coming up in August. There are no phones or TV allowed, we rely on lots of games, outdoor fires, fishing, hiking etc. This game will be an integral part of the week. We will build a "totem" for everyone there. A great team exercise, sharing our feelings about our loved ones. I expect it will surprise a few of my adult children and the grandchildren will delight in being told how well they are doing by their aunts and uncles etc etc.
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: This game is fantastic! It has been so helpful with kids who ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is fantastic! It has been so helpful with kids who have low self-esteem getting comfortable with praise and positive comments. The kids at work have not stopped playing it. It does require reading skills so I don't know how good it would be with younger children or persons with limited cognitive abilities. It would be cool to have a set for those with lower reading skills. Regardless, I love this game.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L

customer_reviews.title: The students loved it & I found it very beneficial
customer_reviews.text: Used it as a lesson for my 8th grade FCS class. Did a modified version & didn't keep track of points. The students loved it & I found it very beneficial. Helpful tool on so many levels. Sincerely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Ann Kufro

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic personal development game
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful game to play with your older kids, family and friends because it allows you to share positive characteristics you appreciate in those people. We've enjoyed creating totems; it has been both fun and insightful.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mannering

customer_reviews.title: Time well spent.
customer_reviews.text: It's so easy to become detached and indifferent, particularly in this fast-paced world where human interaction often involves a "device." This is a non-intrusive, fun way to create positive energy. My husband, son and I had a tense evening after day's grueling schedule feeding the capitalist machine. Instead of allowing things to spiral out of control, we decided to try this game. Took only a few minutes to play. At the end of the game everyone was smiling.
customer_reviews.author: Anne McCarty

customer_reviews.title: This might be the best thing I've purchased as a therapist!
customer_reviews.text: What a great game! Santa put it in my stocking for Christmas (with a little help from me) and I couldn't wait to use it. I have used it with several supervision groups and it has been so great to see how accurate the descriptions are, the variety of animals and qualities, and how different the results are for each individual! I love it so much, it's been great to use as a reminder to my staff of their own strengths when things become overwhelming or hard in our work. Please make more things like this! It's the best thing in my therapy toolbox!
customer_reviews.author: lulublue3

customer_reviews.title: Heartwarming
customer_reviews.text: My son is 7.5 and he loves this game. He doesn't really understand the words when he needs to pick out qualities for other players, but boy oh boy, does he love it when he is the "dealer" and gets all the compliments/kindness directed at him. It's pretty cute. This is a great game for family night.
customer_reviews.author: AliciaS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well this is great for kids and adults. This is great for individual and groups!! Even families.
customer_reviews.author: Petra

customer_reviews.title: Great for therapy
customer_reviews.text: As a licensed mental health therapist, I've used this game for individual therapy and family therapy. I plan to use it for group therapy as well. You can follow the structured game instructions, but you can also really utilize it anyway you want to. Sometimes I just pull out a couple of cards and have my clients tell me which one is more like them and why, which best represents their family members, which one is one that they want to be more like, etc. I work primarily with clients 11+ but if you explain the qualities, you could use this with younger children as well. My clients have all told me that they really enjoy these cards.
customer_reviews.author: Shananigans428

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feel good game!
customer_reviews.text: Two rounds of this game changed a reluctant, surly teen's mood around in no time, getting her talking about her favorite subject: her! At the same time, she was called upon and able to engage in some positive communication with her younger brother and her mom, a win win for all of us. I wish the game didn't have a "points" system for who knows someone better- this should not be a competition. You do need to know the other players somewhat- would not work with strangers.
customer_reviews.author: Mamafox

customer_reviews.title: This is a good game for teens and adults who know each other.
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed the conversation that was sparked by sharing. The idea of rating the cards, most to least had little value. Guessing who said what might be more fun. I like it as a conversation starter but it's not really a game. I bought this for a disabled adult - it's not as powerful due to the need to understand concepts and have a larger vocabulary. Cards are nice quality and if you, family and friends are open to conversation this is a lovely way to engage. I really like the concept of telling people what you like about them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Schmellick

customer_reviews.title: This is fantastic and confidence boosting for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic and confidence boosting for kids. We built a "totem" for our kids and they built one for us. This should be in every family's house - it teaches the right values to communicate positively with others who listening to the strengths others see in them. A+
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Perlman

customer_reviews.title: Great Game.
customer_reviews.text: Great Game.. may take time with younger kids but they were patient and enjoyed learning about each other. Works best after you know each other.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Randgaard

customer_reviews.title: Great therapeutic tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a therapist and I use this with individuals and families. It helps open the line of communication between family members and assists them in identifying personal and family strengths that can be used to help the family system thrive! Individually, I use it to assist clients with self esteem, self efficacy and feelings, thoughts about significant others in their lives. These cards are great and there are numerous ways they can be used therapeutically. Glad I purchased them!!!
customer_reviews.author: CounselingDisciple

customer_reviews.title: My clients like the cards
customer_reviews.text: I did not use it as a game, I picked out a couple of the animal cards for my young clients and told them why I chose certain animals. Then I handed the animal cards to the children and teens and let them choose as many animal cards as they felt described them. We talked about them, then I had them choose their top five to share with another person if they chose to. It has been wonderful to see how my young clients like to pick out their animals and feel they are what the description says. Great self esteem builder.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonangel

customer_reviews.title: A fun, guided conversation catalyst more than a “game”
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to help children (and adults) learn to understand and believe in their self-worth and to support others in the same manner. I think it would be a great periodic “game” to aid in social development with children on the spectrum. It gives them a chance to think about how someone else feels or to show how they perceive someone else and discuss why they think that. It is a great, feel good emotion discussion tool. Not everyone feels self-confident and invincible all the time (and there is probably a Psych 101 definition for that type of person).
customer_reviews.author: Nifty

customer_reviews.title: Really great feel good game for groups
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for building up others in a group setting. As a therapist, I used it with twin clients and with only the three of us, it wasn't hard or easy to accomplish. However, the dilemma was the age guides. I believe the game says 8+ and my clients were 10 years old. The descriptions, although were easy and clear from my perspective, was a tad difficult for them to understand. Overall, it is a great game. I'm going to bring it to my supervision meeting to see if my cohorts want to play it with me.
customer_reviews.author: Léah

customer_reviews.title: Great family game
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a camping trip with family. It was eye opening for everyone to see how they were viewed by others and even made a few people tear up from the kind words they were told. For the rest of the week, we referred to each other by our “totem” names. I wouldn’t recommend it for young children due to slightly advanced vocabulary used.
customer_reviews.author: I just want good coffee

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for esteem building
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool for giving groups or families opportunities to support one another. Excellent for supporting self esteem with teens. In my experience with this tool, I find kids like hearing what others think about them, especially when that feedback is positive. I'm an in-home counselor and of all the tools in my"kit bag," this is the one that gets the most favorable response.
customer_reviews.author: SubtlePneuma

customer_reviews.title: Positive Results and Feedback
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sets of Totem to use as a team builder in a professional development meeting for 30 people (in groups of 5-6 players). After everyone had a Totem, we went around the room to reveal our animals. There were a lot of smiles. Someone remarked that it was interesting to hear what OTHER people thought your strengths are. Another attendee said, "That game was really FUN!" I consider it an unqualified success and will use it again. For a group this size, I needed 3 sets of cards to have enough for 7 cards each round. I would appreciate a bulk discount or a multi-pack for larger teams.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Froehle

customer_reviews.title: Great therapeutic activity/game
customer_reviews.text: I am a mental health counselor at an eating disorder treatment center and purchased Totem to use with my patients. I have now used it with groups of adults and kids ages 10 through 50’s and they have all loved it! We use it for “team building,” to do something special for a group when a member is discharging, or just whenever! It is best for teens and older, but is enjoyable and inspires emotional connection for people of all ages. I highly recommend it for therapists, businesses, and families!
customer_reviews.author: Vivaldigirl

customer_reviews.title: Not my kind of game
customer_reviews.text: I am not impressed with the game and would describe it as “cheesy” and not a lot of fun. Essentially, you are boosting your fellow team player’s self-esteem. So, Totem’s objective is wonderful, but due to its simple, unchallenging rules, I became bored. Like I said, the game’s purpose is great, but its execution or play is dull.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Great way to empower and lift up those in the conversation.
customer_reviews.text: We have used the totem cards in our youth group to break down cliques and build self esteem and it's worked. The youth (middle school and high school) asked to use them again, so we ordered a second pack so we could break the group down in smaller groups and they loved it. I practiced on my family at Christmas and it gave us a chance to have really important conversations and understand each other better. I HIGHLY recommend this product to any youth director, teacher, counselor, supervisor, friend or family member. It is such a versatile and valuable tool. Try it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Game for Everyone.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift. So fun. The rules are light and straight forward. The game concept is a genius. The positive conversations and reflections it brings are amazing. Definitely a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent (instead of psychiatry down the road)
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product that enabled my whole family to share a very positive moment. It’s great for people in each others lives to take a break from all the negativity and judgmental comments we input into each other (with good intentions) to just build each other up with some very thoughtful and kind words - Totem is the game that allows us to do just that. Whole family loved it and glowed about the game for days. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, complicated directions
customer_reviews.text: Several of the “counseling squad” have purchased this without discussion with peers, which is interesting. Idea of the “game” or interaction is positive and supports recognizing positive strengths and attitudes in others. However, the directions for “play” are a bit wordy and honestly, confusing. Not sure it could have been developed using an easier process.
customer_reviews.author: southernshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept; Needs Re-vamping
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept but I think that it could be made better and more applicable to older children, teens, and adults. Possibly adding an improve upon stack could start important conversations as well. As much as the good is important, the “bad” can be a hook that is used to include everyone and still be transformed into good. I thought the concept was excellent but simplistic. It could’ve been made into a better game with more complexity that was still used for all age group.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Game !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent team building game to conduct with teams that are familiar with one another or have worked together for a good period of time. It's very time consuming but well worth the time invested. Persons that participate are encouraged and my even become a little emotional because they didn't realized how much others see in them. I would recommend it for families and counseling sessions as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Not for home families really...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was something that could be played with my family continuously but I don't really see it being used with the same ppl more than once or twice. I wanted to work on my children's self esteem rather than going out of our home to get help... if I was a therapist- this would be amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun way to see what others perception of you is. It is a feel good game but be aware there is a little competition as to which animal or quality you end up picking for your totem.It's all good fun and engenders thoughts about your fellow players as well as some eye openers for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: mc

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun to play
customer_reviews.text: I am a graduate mental health student and I am using this in my group for summer residency along with narrative and art therapy techniques to explore those parts of ourselves and others that we may miss or take for granted. This game allows good insight and conversation into those aspects. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: artsywho

customer_reviews.title: What a moving game!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a school counselor and so excited to play this game with my clients! I played it with my husband before bringing it to work to try it out and we both ended up in tears. It prompts you to not only kindly express your respect for other players, but to also stand up for the statements you make about them. It almost puts you in a position to argue about how incredible the other players are. I’d highly recommend this for family therapy sessions, coworker team building, and small well established therapy groups
customer_reviews.author: jooliagoolia

customer_reviews.title: Great for Mental health workers
customer_reviews.text: As a new clinician working with children and families, i am constantly looking for activities that will be both entertaining, insightful, offer opportunities for growth, and to improve communication. So far I have played this game with 4 families and children ranging from 10-17. Each family has reported loving the game with several parents become emotional when describing why they chose certain cards for their children. I also been incredibly helpful for parents to also see how their children view them and help them bond. Overall great product! i have recommended it to several clinicians i work with. I look forward to continue to use this game in future with my clients.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great way to connect with family and friends.
customer_reviews.text: My family (adults and teens) agreed to "humor mom" and play my new game, Totem, at Thanksgiving this year. Two hours later, after tears, laughter, and new-found respect for one another, we all had our totems. We agreed that we will play this game every year. We are going to do it with the grade school age kids at Christmas. This was a wonderful way for us to articulate wonderful things we see in one another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My students love it!
customer_reviews.text: They have requested to play it each day since I introduced it a little while ago. Each student gets something from the game, even if they are uncertain at first or like some of my students, have trouble hearing positive messages about themselves. At some point it will help them to accept those positive messages, at least I hope they will. This activity certainly provides a platform for increase self-confidence and self-worth. Thanks to the developers for the hard work and for sharing your brilliant ideas with the rest of us.
customer_reviews.author: DK105

customer_reviews.title: Sweet, lovely family game
customer_reviews.text: This was a really sweet and uplifting game to play as a family, especially being in lockdown due to COVID-19. It took some practice to get the hang of it, but once we did, it was a lovely bonding experience, and we talked about it for days! I’m glad we got it when we did...it was a bright experience in a difficult time.
customer_reviews.author: DED

customer_reviews.title: Fun and a great game
customer_reviews.text: We played this game with co-workers to learn to play before we used it with kids. We thought it gave us ways to share the good qualities in others and to see what others see in ourselves. With 4 players it took about an hour to play. We feel that everyone playing must know the persons you are playing with in order for this game to work. Fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An amazing tool
customer_reviews.text: my students love these cards, I have ordered this item twice , second one is a gift for my brother in law who wants to use it with his employees. excellent tool for session opener, closer and reflection. Thanks and keep making these cool tools.
customer_reviews.author: Sameera

customer_reviews.title: Over priced?
customer_reviews.text: Played once when it got here, then left it in the classroom for students to try it out. Very positive and beneficial experience. Pricey, but possibly worth it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great for counselors that run groups
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED THIS GAME. I’ve used this for groups so far. I work in an inpatient drug and alcohol facility with female individuals. This game fit in nicely with our processes groups, and ran like a strengths based johari window. Seeing the facial expressions and positive impact of members offering feedback to one another through this game was amazing to witness. I will definitely continue to use this to help facilitate groups in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tayler

customer_reviews.title: Such a sweet game
customer_reviews.text: My kids 10 and 9 loved this game! They were smiling from ear to ear! If you want a way to get conversation going about positive qualities of each other this is a great little game for it! My husband and I even enjoyed it and had a good time. Recommended for families .
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great holiday game with family.
customer_reviews.text: Played this game on Thanksgiving Night. It was a great way to discuss positive things about each other. There's no winners or losers, just a good way to have an open discussion on how we view ourselves and how others view us from a positive perspective.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: very long
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for centers in my guidance room for for 3rd-5th graders. The game is very time consuming and the students have been getting frustrated waiting for their turn. I also purchased other games that have been more enjoyable for them. I would recommend this game for only 4 players.
customer_reviews.author: sharon l borst

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This game is not worth $24.00 it is just a pack of cards. It also is not appropriate for adolescents they do not understand several of the descriptions. It shouldn't be listed as counseling tool for kids that age. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hummel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great game! I have low functioning Autistic kids in a group I run. They were so engaged and focused that I was in disbelief. First group in a while that went without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Judy L

customer_reviews.title: This is the best game!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this game for team building activities and as therapy for our clientele. This is a great feel good game. When I'm trying to cut the game short, I use the animal cards and have my students explain to each other why they picked that card. Everyone lights up when they find out that so many people think so highly of them. I highly recommend this game.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: "Great idea and way to build self esteem"
customer_reviews.text: "I like the idea of it. When my children arrive at the table on some nights I take out a card and tell them something specific that I like about them. It isn't about how the game works, but in the situation I'm in where I have teenagers, it's great to tell them something great about themselves that they might not be aware of."
customer_reviews.author: Annikki McCord

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful team building- and family building
customer_reviews.text: We bought this game for our family. Although some of the vocabulary was above my kids' levels, we enjoy playing this with friends and visiting family to build each other up. :) Very sweet game.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Becwar

customer_reviews.title: Really powerful, strengths based game
customer_reviews.text: Our teams really got a lot out of this game. For large groups it can take a while for the all the tables to get done. The game took about an hour so plan accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Baker

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game to have a feel-good moment with friends at Christmas. Was really surprised at the impact it had. Quite an eye-opener and the experience will be remembered for a long time. I’m sure we will make this at least an annual tradition.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Hey Miss Bossy Pants
customer_reviews.text: Buy this now!!!! Immediately!!!’ What are you doing? Go! Fine, Miss Bossy Pants, I love this game. It’s all positive, there’s no talking trash. It’s uplifting and gets people to express themselves and build each other up. Now Miss Bossy Pants, it’s time for you to go buy this. I like those pants on you, by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: For Older Kids
customer_reviews.text: This game is definitely for older kids, but because of the content, I don't think older kids would be interested in it. It wasn't what I expected and was a little disappointed. Instead of playing the "game" I am just using them to hand out as compliment cards. They list many positive qualities.
customer_reviews.author: Bumgarner Family

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful cards
customer_reviews.text: I liked the game. It’s a meaningful way to connect with others. The cards are also beautiful. We learned a lot about how others see us and got competitive in trying to convince the dealer to change their chosen totem cards. It would be helpful to get some ideas on other ways of playing, as I don’t see the need to play it more than once with the same people, since it’s based on personality which doesn’t change much over time. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic game
customer_reviews.text: Totem was a fantastic game. Because we played it with 35 staff members, we bought two packs and adjusted the instructions a bit. Everyone loved it. Being able to highlight each other’s strengths in this way was a great team building activity!
customer_reviews.author: BAI

customer_reviews.title: Therapy Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game to utilize in therapy. I play the game with the children that I work with and then assigned them the task of drawing a totem pole for themselves, challenging them to identify their own strengths and choosing animals that best represent them. I just wish that some of the language was a bit more simplified, since my 8yr old patients needed me to explain multiple words.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Subers

customer_reviews.title: This is a feel-good game that kids love!
customer_reviews.text: I have two nieces born prematurely with some challenges. One niece with some emotional challenges, and one with some learning challenges. They LOVE this game. It has really helped with confidence issues already.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Wildner

customer_reviews.title: Really lovely and connecting
customer_reviews.text: We used these for our wedding. We did a scavenger hunt where people got to know each other and have one another tokens of affection. Totem was one of the tokens. I can’t tell you how connecting and lovely it is to read a positive attribute, given by a loved one. Thanks for making this game!
customer_reviews.author: Ceallaigh

customer_reviews.title: Really like this for use with the children and adolescents I work with.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. You need more than two players but you could still use it with just two. Love the idea and it’s purpose for promoting self-esteem.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis In Wonderland

customer_reviews.title: I cannot wait to play with these! Very fast delivery!
customer_reviews.text: I have absolutely no regrets! So cute...what a positive way to play with intense topics. Fun and very practical. Very simple art which is so needed,
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Love this game
customer_reviews.text: My clients are really into it. from grown women to young boys who at 1st made fun of it and them ended up being very invested. excellent card game to get clients engaged and thinking about "insight"
customer_reviews.author: Dragon-FoxTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Totem can help people get I touch with their emotional lives for a healthier life!
customer_reviews.text: I am a mental health professional. I purchased the game to bring a family together and help them access their feelings. Our culture does not teach us how to do that unfortunately, and repressing our emotions tends to cause mental and physical disorders. Thank you for helping people to move toward this goal with your game.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Curet

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FAMILY THERAPY ACTIVITY!
customer_reviews.text: This game was even more fun than I thought it would be. I played it with a family in therapy and they were surprised how much they knew about each other and really enjoyed giving compliments they would not normally have brought up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids
customer_reviews.text: The concept behind this game is great. I have an 8 and 10 year old and this game is too advanced for them. I'd love to see a kid version with words they understand.
customer_reviews.author: Hallie Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for short-classroom interventions
customer_reviews.text: I see the intent of this game. I am sure it works for many therapists. But as school social worker that does a lot of experiential learning and has 30 minutes tops for interventions with classrooms this is not useful as intended. I had to modify its use. Good concepts though
customer_reviews.author: Cecy

customer_reviews.title: Young kids love it too
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure if this game was going to work for our 6 and 8 year old kids, since reviews talked about older kids liking it, but I still wanted to get it. I’m glad I did, cause we all loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Ga Roz

customer_reviews.title: Very interesting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mostly for a 12 year old niece going through a rough patch. We didn't play exactly to rules because it was initially her and me. Then my mother joined us and I liked how it pleased her when my niece and I chose cards for her. All in all, it is beneficial for anyone who joins in.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Not a family game
customer_reviews.text: We didn’t enjoy this as a family game. There was not enough challenge. I guess it is meant for a therapist, not family game night.
customer_reviews.author: HelpfulReviews

customer_reviews.title: A must have to help team morale!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve played during staff meetings and huddles, it has been FUN, positive and uplifting. I can immediately see the energy shift and everyone feels different. A morale booster and a must have! Don’t think about it just do it and see. I did have to change the rules a bit to make it go faster. I’m sharing with my family and friends and the rest of the Management team.
customer_reviews.author: LeticiaGonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Inspiring & Positive
customer_reviews.text: Played this with staff and looking forward to playing with students. What a feel-good game! I highly recommend it to boost morale and build relationships.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mercer

customer_reviews.title: This is a MUST have game!
customer_reviews.text: We love love love this game! It’s so refreshing to play a game with the family that doesn’t cause conflict or grief in some way. I think it’s a gem and I am telling everyone about it! We play it as a family and my kids are 13 and 11 and love it too!!
customer_reviews.author: JACKIE ZWEIFEL

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Wholesome Game for Families
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this game to use with my family therapy clients. Gave it a test run on my own kids 4-9 first. My older two (7 and 9) were really into it and loved their 'totems'! The 4 year old didn't quite understand the concept and wanted to make off with all the "ocean animal" cards. For 6+ this is a great way to identify strengths and build connections! Looking forward to using it in client sessions!
customer_reviews.author: Helen Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Such a wonderful game that lifts your spirits!!
customer_reviews.text: This game is so great! It can be played with family and friends or with your team. It's seriously the feel good game! I would highly recommend this game! My family loves it and I can see me using it for team building as well at work.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous-Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for family therapy sessions
customer_reviews.text: SUCH a great game for family therapy sessions!!! I use this with clients of all ages to do with their siblings, parents, ect. It is totally strengths based but still opens up for so much self reflection and deep conversation. It worked great with a teen client and mom who are awful at communicating. So many different cards and qualities. Also a great experience for clients to expand their vocabulary.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Leith

customer_reviews.title: Great Family game!
customer_reviews.text: With 8 people playing it took a while to get through the game. Our 5 year old grandson isnt reading so we took the time to explain the cards and help him pick. The whole family enjoyed the game. Our daughter in law afterward said "I feel like a brand new person" There were tears and laughter during the game. Exactly what I was hoping for!
customer_reviews.author: April Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great game to use with family and groups
customer_reviews.text: Great game to use with family and groups. My supervisor turned us onto in group supervision and fell in love with it. I especially love that I got it for such a good deal during Prime Days....
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Wholesome fun
customer_reviews.text: I brought this game into my classroom for my freshmen to play and it was a total mood shift! Kids loved it and they didn’t even realize they were spreading positivity. Excellent and wholesome game!
customer_reviews.author: Charise Moore

customer_reviews.title: Nice Change
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice change in gaming. It really helped build our perspective of our selves because we got to see what other people thought of us. No competition as it is not intended to have a winner. Everyone just was able to feel good. FYI it was all adults playing the game as well. I think we all need to hear positive feed back from peers as adults as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game !
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t played yet but I love the concept ! Very positive game to play and get to understand people better.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Emotional, honest, uplifting game.
customer_reviews.text: In our house, we mostly like CAH and Joking Hazzard, but I tried this, hoping to use it as an opportunity to say some nice things to each other. It went very well, but was a bit draining. We plan to go back to it, but not too soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jake T

customer_reviews.title: Love this game
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what its title is the feel good game. I play it with my fiancé and friends and we all end up loving, respecting and appreciating each other and ourselves so much more. Its so easy to play and you will discover wonderful things about yourself.
customer_reviews.author: FARAHDREAMS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: As a therapist I've been playing Totem with clients, both children and adults, for two straight weeks. I honestly can't get enough of it. I've only heard positive feedback about this activity from everyone who has played. What a wonderful opportunity for people to learn more about their own strengths and gain insight into others' observations of their strengths as well. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game to play with your teenagers
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great tool that leads to some good family discussions. Positive reinforcement for teens/tweeners in those difficult years.
customer_reviews.author: AmyK

customer_reviews.title: Game
customer_reviews.text: It was offensive. I do not think you’re going to tell someone if you picked all the bad cards. that you didn’t like anything about them .did not like it
customer_reviews.author: beverly ARMSTRONG

customer_reviews.title: Dive in and enjoy this game of revelation
customer_reviews.text: This game is thought provoking and allows the players to connect ant another level with one another. It also reveals the feeling we have for each others. Our family enjoyed the game.
customer_reviews.author: C&MBenson

customer_reviews.title: Great family game...
customer_reviews.text: My kids love it and it provides a way to share the great things you enjoy about the people in your family. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very positive everyone wins
customer_reviews.text: My eight year old daughter has been struggling with her self esteem. We’ve played it twice and she loves it! She is learning lots of new vocabulary with too.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A. Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: It helps if all players can read.
customer_reviews.text: I have three kids, ages 6, 8, and 11. It is difficult sometimes to help everyone feel known and seen and encouraged. This is definitely a great “game” to play with your kids. Thank you to the creators. They are beautiful cards and encourage beautiful conversations.
customer_reviews.author: Amy H.

customer_reviews.title: only older kids can understand
customer_reviews.text: no way this is for 8yo, even 10yo its hard. disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: L Choi

customer_reviews.title: Great family game!
customer_reviews.text: Great game! My wife and I enjoyed playing "Totem" with our three adult children. It was surprising how accurately the animal and character cards described the good qualities of each family member. The experience was a refreshing change from most games which tend to be competitive and sometimes devisive. Each family member walked away feeling celebrated. Everyone is a winner!
customer_reviews.author: D.J.

customer_reviews.title: So much Fun and Rewarding
customer_reviews.text: I have a team of 9 nurses for clinical informatics. We played this at the end of our team meeting and they loved it. They were so impressed that no card repeated and how true they were to the person described. so rewarding thank you
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Can I return item or exchange
customer_reviews.text: Working with young people and the item was not feasible for them. Would like to exchange to another item
customer_reviews.author: diva

customer_reviews.title: Positive, feel good game
customer_reviews.text: A really great reminder of all the positive energy we have. A great team building tool for coworkers, a wonderful self reminder of ones own traits and a perfect way to open the discussion about positive personal traits during a therapy session. Loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Yee

customer_reviews.title: Must play game for families
customer_reviews.text: This game brought the family closer together and we learned things about each other through the game. It facilitated a positive feel good environment! We played for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Babb

customer_reviews.title: Inspiring
customer_reviews.text: This game was used in a middle school classroom to help build community and self-esteem. The students needed lots of modeling to take it seriously (that was to be expected), but the game, concept, etc. was outstanding! It was incredibly impactful, and I will definitely be using it again!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Harms

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic family therapy activity!
customer_reviews.text: Great activity for working to build parent-child and family relationships in therapy sessions! I found a nice little hidden gem!
customer_reviews.author: Amy L

customer_reviews.title: Family friendly game
customer_reviews.text: We have loved it every time we have played. Our children ask to play it every day. We can see the positive effect it has with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Totem the feel good game, Self-Esteem Game for Team Building, School, Family Bonding, Counseling and Therapy
feature_bullets: Family/Friends building : Foster and strengthen positive relationships by playing a conversation card game that encourages people to look at their bright side
Team building activities : Managers and coaches can use it to build cohesion and trust amongst team members and work colleagues
Therapy game : A therapeutic tool that school teachers, parents, counselors and psychologists can use. it can be used with groups or individuals

Self-esteem builder : Meaningful conversation starter using an animal card and a quality card chosen and explained by the other players; 6400 available totems that demonstrate a positive aspect of your personality
💗 The Power to bring someone to Tears: When players connect at a deeper level and the magic happen, you may feel that you get too much love and kindness. Just take it, you deserve it.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars432 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
